H0.text: Kinetic theory states that there is no interaction between individual gas particles.

H1.text: Viscosity theory states that there is no interaction between individual gas particles.

H2.text: Vortex theory states that there is no interaction between individual gas particles.

H3.text: Avoidance theory states that there is no interaction between individual gas particles.

A4.text: Interactions (i.e. collisions) between particles are strictly binary and uncorrelated, meaning that there are no three-body (or higher) interactions, and the particles have no memory.

A5.text: They exert no other forces on one another.
